name: Charlie Ray
text: This is a wonderful small Huntsville history center full to the brim with one of a kind artifacts and historical memorabilia. The owners are kind and super fun to talk to. Please visit and look at all the art, history, and listen to stories about the people who really made and build Huntsville Alabama.

resp.text: Thank you so much! We appreciate your feedback and are so happy you enjoyed visiting the gallery and museum!

name: Perry Hendrix
text: This museum has a great exhibit of the pow camp that was in aliceville. Lots of donated artifacts. Must see! Also has a intact Coca-Cola plant. I believe they said it was the only one of its kind still intact in a small rural community. I will go back

name: Jeff Schmidt
text: Very informative and interesting place that highlights some of the lost history of America during the war. Though the original camp is gone; the museum is full of artifacts from the place along with notes and artwork created by the prisoners.

name: Walt Sanders
text: To much to say...it’s a very good museum that covers part of Alabama history that is not well known or taught.   There’s so much to read and look at, plan on taking your time.  But wait there’s more!! A Coke A Cola museum in the same building!   Now that you’ve seen this please go in the building across the courtyard and stroll through the section that covers the citizens of Aliceville and surrounding areas.  Please give this museum a try, what it lacks in size makes up in volume.

resp.text: Thank you! We are happy you came to see us.

name: Laurie Cavender
text: Enjoyed an afternoon here browing the POW artifacts and the coke bottling museum.  A 2 hour drive for us, but absolutely worth it ❤

name: Fran Duncan
text: This museum is packed with history!  The attendant was knowledgeable and we could tell excited about sharing his love of history. The military section was packed with artifacts -many more than museums much larger. This is well worth the trip.

resp.text: Thank you so much! We are happy that you enjoyed your visit.

name: Pam Hurst
text: My husband is a history buff, especially WWII, and grew up hearing stories about a German spy that reported from close to Gulf Shores. I love museums for the "people " aspect of them. We were both delighted with Aliceville's  museum of the WWII prison camp  and of Aliceville' history. The person that led us through was informative.

resp.text: Thank you - enjoyed having you visit!

name: Will Tyler
text: Great stories of an interesting time in America's history to be found here. The German POW exhibit in particular gives a new perspective on what it means to be an American both then and now.

name: Ronald Kasten
text: This museum is a gem. Well worth going out of your way to visit if you are interested in WWII and German POWs in the US.

name: Chris Potter
text: I've never been here but Google keeps putting this up.

name: Sally Evenden
text: Very friendly informative host with many interesting stories and artifacts
